review_title: Great pay, benefits, and great people
pros:
If you're willing to roll up your sleeves and work as part of a team, PCA may be the right place for you. We're growing and our products are in high demand so there are plenty of overtime opportunities. We don't have layoffs and we're always looking for new employees.

Please understand, this is hard work that requires a personal commitment to working long hours (sometimes up to 12 hour shifts) depending on staffing shortages or customer demand. The upside is you can provide a very stable living for yourself and your family. The 401K and benefits are outstanding. Some weeks, I have to work 6 days a week (Mon- Sat) and a swing shift (1st/ 2nd) is a requirement unless you're willing to work 3rd. I enjoy working with 97% of my co-workers. The 97% understand what is required of them; 1) show up to work 2) put forth an honest day's work for an honest day's pay 3) show a willingness to learn and work in a team environment 4) keep your whining and complaining to a minimum. The 3% usually take care of themselves and end up being terminated, but it's the 3% that can make it a miserable work day for the other 97% who are counting on the 3% to still do their show up and do their jobs.

Each of us (the 97%) who have the drive and initiative will bend over backwards to help you succeed if you willing to fully accept the 4 requirements mentioned above. I consider some of my colleagues and coworkers as my extended family. I haven't felt this way working for other employers, but the offsetting downside is you do have to work alot. If you have a deep seated aversion to working, you will hands-down will not work out here. You will not make it more than 60 days (your probationary period).

This is a very candid and honest assessment; if you're struggling with requirements 1-3, please flat out don't work with us. We're willing to overlook requirement #4 (complaining) as this will dissipate when you see the overwhelming support you'll get with the appearance you're committed to working here. I cannot speak that every PCA plant operates the same, but it's the people, the "right people," that clearly make the difference. Middletown was named Turnaround Plant of the Year" 2 years ago pre-Covid. What won it? The "right people" committed to winning. We're back trending in the right direction in '21 and early '22. We just need more winning attitudes and folks willing to come in to work.
cons: Long hours and limited time off ( 1 week of vacation to start)

cons:

If you wish to be looked down upon, and treated as No more than the machine you operate this is the place for you.  

As for Bonuses they will cheat you out of it, then go back say it was a mistake on their part, in the end you still get screwed.

review_title: PCA is an employer that values thoughtful work and provides opportunities for those willing to accept responsibility.
pros: Employees are long-tenured, know their jobs and customers well and treat others with respect. People are always willing to listen to others' ideas and implement win-win solutions. Management expects people to give something like time to the company when required but they give that time back when employees need it. A newer generation of management has been coming up and they are more approachable than past management. Box plant management is friendly and is concerned about relationship building.
cons: Conservatve approach to acquiring others. Would like to see more investment in more geographical areas in order to grow the footprint.  A lot of mill focus, i.e., cost side.  Would like to see more revenue opportunities.  Prima-donnas are tolerated.

review_title: Top management focuses only on operations
pros: Since the acquisition of Boise Inc., PCA is able to compete more effectively in the consumer packaging industry due to increase in revenues and expanded geographical coverage within the U.S.
cons: PCA has a decentralized business model and historically outsourced most corporate functions.  In fact, PCA does not value corporate cost center functions like Accounting & Finance, Human Resources, and IT.  They starve these departments of financial resources, make those employees work with outdated technology, and expect those employees to work crazy hours for extended periods of time when problems occur.  After a series of acquisitions over the past 5-10 years, because PCA has not upgraded its financial software, it has not been able to integrate the acquired companies into PCA's financial systems to efficiently consolidate financial results on a monthly basis.  Their corporate financial systems are held together by figurative duct tape.  Not a place to advance your career.

review_title: anonymous - I still work here...for now
pros: Pay and Benefits and as an hourly employee you are protected by your union
cons: Work/Life balance non-existent.  "Forced" overtime happens all too often because they will not properly staff AND TRAIN people.  Hypocritical management.  They talk about and preach safety being a priority...reality: as long as it it doesn't cost too much money or interfere with production, then it is a priority.  Reactive rather than proactive.  Knee jerk over reaction is the norm.  Blanket blame to all employees rather than on an individual basis.  They preach there is no place for fear and intimidation in the work place yet throughout the company, top production VP's included, they will yell and threaten.  Not uncommon for so called "leaders" to pound tables and throw hard hats.  Kind of comical actually...  Always looking to place blame on a person rather than the process or managerial planning, or lack there of.  Real leadership does not exist.  Employees are a liability, not an asset.  Attitude is "next man up" with total disregard for the years of service and knowledge a person brings to the table.

review_title: Company's Wall Street Performance Valued Above People
pros: Salary and benefits are above industry standards. No formal, forced performance metrics or evaluations for salaries/bonus. Supervisors are to know specifically what you are doing and how you are performing.
cons:
Salary and benefits are above industry standards due to 24/7/365 access to employee "requirements". Vacations are to be taken; however if called you have less than 24 hours to get back to whatever deemed emergency needed you physically on site. 
High turnover in all positions that are below the VP level. Remaining staff is doing the jobs off all unfilled positions.  Cost cutting, personnel layoffs, postponing customer payments are driven by Wall Street commitments at quarter end reporting to hit numbers. 
Executive integrity does not exist. The emperor is never told he is wrong which also transfers to the Senior VP's and business units.

review_title: Good Company but Lacking Qualified Managers

These issues are immediately noticed by current employees which in turn kills morale and eventually production/quality. Like adding gasoline to a fire. Great policy, great teaching and idea of culture but watch out for the buddy system. I really hate to speak of the company this way because it has not always been like this.

pros: Consistent work and working in the same place
cons: 6 days a week, mandatory overtime start, start at 4 am, no energy for life outside of work, destroys your body, morale was very low there, people there are just barely holding on, lots of temporary workers cycle through that you have to train (most of them are high),  we had several people that we had to train that couldn't read a tape measure nor an analog clock nor how to use a ratchet. Every month I was surprised that the company was still running.

Yelling and cursing at direct reports in front of hourly, etc. Our organization has lost a lot of knowledge due to this behavior. Many senior employees left for a better working experience.

review_title: If you're a woman and work here get out now if you're going to apply DON'T!!!
pros: Men get all the breaks otherwise there are no pros
cons: PCA took a bad company and made it worse when they bought Boise. Good ole boy network is alive and well, the hidden pay gap is huge and to add insult to injury, those on the lower end of the gap do all of the work, while the good ole boy cronies give each other 20 percent raises behind the scenes. I accidently found proof which made me sick after working 80+ weeks for nothing.

pros: Great People, treated well, sense of team, golden rule enviroment

Commission rate lowest in industry because it is based on margin and volume, you can forget about the margin side of it. PCA pricing system is set up for the house. They keep individual sales awards a secret for some unexplained reason.

cons: Men seem to be promoted more often than women. There are women that have been here years in the same positions. It would be nice to see more women in upper management and more women promoted within the organization.

pros: Great Bennefits, pay is great. I believe it is over 23 an hour for new hires after 3 months, and more money do to excess overtime available and mandatory.
cons: Management will try to force overtime and at some points cross the legal law and threaten discipline if you answer call-in while off. Discipline isn't consistent with cases and union contract with discipline is not followed by company. Not considered a person. Just a number.

pros: People are wonderful, and if you are in with the right group you could go far. HR has changed and seems to be for the better, but they have much work to bring the company into the 21st century. Company seems to favor minorities, which makes for a nice, diverse working environment.
cons: PTO is not monitored through payroll, so some get 2 weeks and others get 6. Some departments are awesome and others play favoritism. Slackers seem to rule the roost, even when actions are pointed out to management.

pros: Good pay for the type of work. It is an industry that the country needs due to transportation regulations so it has some job security for the time being.  PCA takes care of the employees that do good work.
cons: Can be tedious working in a factory.  It is not the safest environment or the most comfortable. In order to stay ahead of the competition PCA makes promises that are hard to keep. Stress management is important.

review_title: PCA is now lost in the integration shuffle.
pros: Growing company (as a result of the recent acquisition of Boise, Inc.). Long-tenured employees who are incredibly loyal to the company.
cons: Growing company with long-tenured employees who are out of their element trying to manage the integration with Boise.  Communication has gotten very poor.

job_title: Valet Attendant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Flexible Scheduling and the possibility to make good money in tips if at a good property. If at a good property, you can network and meet a lot of great people and drive nice cars. Great co-workers, but again that is dependent on the property you're placed in. (Request fancy/high establishments for better tips)
cons: Like I said, if you have bad days or are at a bad property then tips can be bad, and you'll be stuck with minimum wage. Most valet work involves working in all sorts of weather, rain or shine.

pros: the co-workers are great. seriously like a family. i have only been there a short time but i feel very appreciated and comfortable. my department has 2 ladies and i am the third. they were and are very kind and patient with me. and also everyone else is very down to earth and kind. honestly like a family. we are team mates and i am so very proud to be a part of it.
cons: i am flat footed and also have other issues with my feet. the only con, for me is the steel toed shoes.

pros: Very strong company and always looking to improve operations. The company has a strong management team with paper background that understands the overall business. They have all worked their way up from operations.
cons: Some of their demands are a bit unrealistic but overall they just hold people accountable. Plant managers need to be able to manage their mills instead of having to get approval for everything.

review_title: Manual labor, great pay, great benefits, low recognition
job_title: Flexo Folder Gluer Operator in Liverpool, NY
pros: The pay is great, the bonuses and benefits are top notch. Consistent hours and paid vacation.
cons: Employee recognition is only there if you mess up, if you do something great and amazing like break a record, there's minimal attention from management when there should be noticeable praise.

review_title: Great experience working with people that were friendly and helpful at all times. God opportunity to develop customer
pros: Develop great customer service skills. Company gives flexible hours and management is very laid back and understanding. Always busy doing work, helping people
cons: Nothing to report. Everything was a positive experience and I can't really say anything was bad about the company. Recommend to other people. Only but the best things about this company

review_title: The company values its' people, so it is natural and easy to take care of the customer...
job_title: Sales Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
-Culture is the Golden Rule and the management practices what it preaches.
-chance to grow internally
-can make lots of money in sales
-very good training for employees
-the company recognizes and celebrates the employees
cons: -in sales, if one does not have the relationships to bring over, or does not grow  by the millions in the first 2 years, it is hard to make a living.

job_title: Rotary Diecut Operator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Pay and Benefits were all that was good.
cons: Management dont really care for you. Its all about the production of the company.  Safety is tweaked. I watched how one HARD WORKING employee that worked crazy OT and came in when they called and stayed late when they asked exhaust himself to the work. You know he loved his job. Well, This individual got injured and the company didnt want to take care of him and eventually letting him go.

review_title: Lives up to the mission statement "People, Customers, Trust"
pros: Great corporate culture, treat employees as people, not numbers, from plant level to upper management. Opportunites for growth and continuing education. Great salaries and benefits, as to be expected from a Fortune 500 company. Also reward dedicated employees with generous annual bonuses.
cons: Occasionly, some management can seem stuffy to someone not used to a Fortune 500 company environment.

review_title: PCA was a fast-paced workplace that required long hours and dedication.
pros: Friendly people, not a lot of office politics, hands-on environment. Everyone is fairly accessible and helpful. Managers are understanding and employees are always willing to help and teach.
cons: Manufacturing comes with a lot of drawbacks, such as long hours when a piece of equipment is down, or high stress due to contractor failure.

pros: This company is very smart with their investments and the way they treat their employees. Over the years they have accrued little debt, and as a result have grown very well in the past few years. Employees are given great opportunities for advancement while providing well balanced management.
cons: The locations of most of their mills are in small, rural towns that some potential employees may not find agreeable.

pros: Company has been around a long time and has many locations therefore there is ample opportunity to relocate to a more desirable part of the country or abroad. Pay is decent depending on area.
cons: Stress organization, yet very unorganized. Stress caring about employees yet hard to get positive or timely results. Communication is very lacking until time for employee anonymous surveys. Open door policy is a joke.

review_title: They emphisis the use of the "Golden Rule" until it's time to actually use it, then they go around it.
job_title: Flexographic Press Assistant in Liverpool, NY
pros: Great pay, great benefits, safety is #1 and they mean it, bonus 2 weeks before Christmas is a huge plus
cons: No room to move up in company, disiplinary actions are usually slaps on the wrist, don't regularly drug test employees who work on heavy machinery

pros: Management at all levels that focus on employees as people and developing them to their fullest potential. Excellent working conditions and benefits.
cons: Vertical management tiers that make it difficult to get decisions made in a timely manner. Many employees there a long time and can be resistant to new ideas or change.

pros: Great benefits; Friendly coworkers; generally competitive pay.
cons: Very antiquated ways of thinking on a corporate level; Cut corners on technology - systematically insist on competitive designs and prices but refuse to supply employees with the appropriate tools.

pros: Benefits were great.  401K was outstanding!  This company is growing.
cons: Facility managers rarely followed up on expectations.  Expectations were not thought thru, just pulled numbers out of a hat.  Rules constantly change.  Too many shades of gray.  Very difficult to get results when 3 shifts are not working towards the same goals.  Hourly employees become frustrated and feel confused, low morale.

job_title: Customer Service Associate in Lake Forest, IL
pros: The starting pay offered to me was at the mid level scale for someone with a Masters Degree.  Ok
cons: The corporate headquarters management team was very negative toward all employees of color. No one was allowed to advance or even consider going to another team. Also they would rather get you off the payroll than consider a annual review and raise.

pros: Decent pay, gain expierice quickly, challenging, decent safety culture
cons: Not a place to work if you're a woman or a young engineer. Will force you out if you don't follow the career progression they pick out for you. The expectation is to live at work, salaried is required to carry cell phones 24/7 and come in at the drop of a hat. Management lacks technical knowledge to run process.

pros: Great pay and benefits.  Lots of job security if you are willing to come to work every day.  Benefits are awesome.
cons: No room for advancement.  They have completely moved away from promoting from within.  If you are happy getting to a certain position and staying there forever then this might be the job for you.

pros: No pros at all for this company
cons: No family life if you have a family you can kiss that good bye. Management dont care about nothing but getting a bonus at the end of the day. I've worked every holiday and they think you should be happy with that. They will lie to get to you in the door to work for them. Dont join they union cause it has no say so when it comes to management or the company.

pros: Great company to work for. Managerial positions given lots of room to utilize their strengths to incorporate ideas to better serve the overall goals of the shipping operations. Constantly presented with opportunities to show ones competency.
cons: Lots of work gets funneled to one or two people, success or failure is the result of the ability of those people to work and manage efficiently.

review_title: PCA was very generous with it's employees through financial compensation and very good benefits.

cons: The employee-chemistry was crucial, for the effectiveness of the independence of all the separate plants.

review_title: Good place if you love learning on the job with a fast and demanding environment.
pros:
•Good work environment 
• Improved communication skills
• Fast paced environment
cons: If something breaks or goes down in your department. You are expected to stay until start up occurs and test the product.

review_title: I worked for Boise until pca.....
pros: Good pay great benefits decent morale. If you need a tool you will have it.
cons: Knee jerk reactions to every little thing. One rule may override 5 others so go with what you heard last. Constant rumors of change. Did not treat our senior employees fairly after the acquisition. I saw 200 years of experience fired in 1 day.

pros: Good entry level job, overtime, paid breaks, some benefits very good to. Some of supervisors nice guys.
cons:
This is union company, so you never can not grow where, "old" guys alway got best position even if you are working twice better. 
 Old plant, old equipment (always have problems with that). 
 Very hot inside (especially at Summer time). Long shifts (have to stay on leg 9-10 hours).

job_title: Machine Center Operator in Plymouth, MI

Management turns a blind eye to major  OSHA safety violations in trade for product out the door numbers. Literally the worst morale I've ever experienced in my working career

pros: 401K, The coworkers are hard working good people to work with. All the people in inside the plant and outside sales really worked hard to satisfy and take care of the customer.

pros: Fair salary. Good working conditions.  Good 401k.

pros: Great Colleagues and Accounts to Work With, Competitive Salary, Good Office Space, Latitude to Perform

pros: Great benefits,  decent pay, advancement opportunities within plant, most plants are union shops, overall great company to be employed through.

pros: Lots of good people to work with.

review_title: Overall good, but job is demanding and has too much politics

pros: Wonderful manager, great co-workers, very little drama, no micro-managing, excellent benefits. Some departments/managers have more drama than others, and I am lucky to work in a department that doesn't have to deal with much of the corporate b.s.

review_title: A good company with room for improvements

pros: Hourly people are amazing. Excellent pay and benefits.

review_title: Wonderful culture and family oriented organization.

pros: People, culture, pay, benefits, vacation

review_title: Great pay, benefits, and great people
pros:
If you're willing to roll up your sleeves and work as part of a team, PCA may be the right place for you. We're growing and our products are in high demand so there are plenty of overtime opportunities. We don't have layoffs and we're always looking for new employees.

Please understand, this is hard work that requires a personal commitment to working long hours (sometimes up to 12 hour shifts) depending on staffing shortages or customer demand. The upside is you can provide a very stable living for yourself and your family. The 401K and benefits are outstanding. Some weeks, I have to work 6 days a week (Mon- Sat) and a swing shift (1st/ 2nd) is a requirement unless you're willing to work 3rd. I enjoy working with 97% of my co-workers. The 97% understand what is required of them; 1) show up to work 2) put forth an honest day's work for an honest day's pay 3) show a willingness to learn and work in a team environment 4) keep your whining and complaining to a minimum. The 3% usually take care of themselves and end up being terminated, but it's the 3% that can make it a miserable work day for the other 97% who are counting on the 3% to still do their show up and do their jobs.

Each of us (the 97%) who have the drive and initiative will bend over backwards to help you succeed if you willing to fully accept the 4 requirements mentioned above. I consider some of my colleagues and coworkers as my extended family. I haven't felt this way working for other employers, but the offsetting downside is you do have to work alot. If you have a deep seated aversion to working, you will hands-down will not work out here. You will not make it more than 60 days (your probationary period).

This is a very candid and honest assessment; if you're struggling with requirements 1-3, please flat out don't work with us. We're willing to overlook requirement #4 (complaining) as this will dissipate when you see the overwhelming support you'll get with the appearance you're committed to working here. I cannot speak that every PCA plant operates the same, but it's the people, the "right people," that clearly make the difference. Middletown was named Turnaround Plant of the Year" 2 years ago pre-Covid. What won it? The "right people" committed to winning. We're back trending in the right direction in '21 and early '22. We just need more winning attitudes and folks willing to come in to work.
cons: Long hours and limited time off ( 1 week of vacation to start)

review_title: PCA is an employer that values thoughtful work and provides opportunities for those willing to accept responsibility.
pros: Employees are long-tenured, know their jobs and customers well and treat others with respect. People are always willing to listen to others' ideas and implement win-win solutions. Management expects people to give something like time to the company when required but they give that time back when employees need it. A newer generation of management has been coming up and they are more approachable than past management. Box plant management is friendly and is concerned about relationship building.
cons: Conservatve approach to acquiring others. Would like to see more investment in more geographical areas in order to grow the footprint.  A lot of mill focus, i.e., cost side.  Would like to see more revenue opportunities.  Prima-donnas are tolerated.

review_title: Top management focuses only on operations
pros: Since the acquisition of Boise Inc., PCA is able to compete more effectively in the consumer packaging industry due to increase in revenues and expanded geographical coverage within the U.S.
cons: PCA has a decentralized business model and historically outsourced most corporate functions.  In fact, PCA does not value corporate cost center functions like Accounting & Finance, Human Resources, and IT.  They starve these departments of financial resources, make those employees work with outdated technology, and expect those employees to work crazy hours for extended periods of time when problems occur.  After a series of acquisitions over the past 5-10 years, because PCA has not upgraded its financial software, it has not been able to integrate the acquired companies into PCA's financial systems to efficiently consolidate financial results on a monthly basis.  Their corporate financial systems are held together by figurative duct tape.  Not a place to advance your career.

review_title: anonymous - I still work here...for now
pros: Pay and Benefits and as an hourly employee you are protected by your union
cons: Work/Life balance non-existent.  "Forced" overtime happens all too often because they will not properly staff AND TRAIN people.  Hypocritical management.  They talk about and preach safety being a priority...reality: as long as it it doesn't cost too much money or interfere with production, then it is a priority.  Reactive rather than proactive.  Knee jerk over reaction is the norm.  Blanket blame to all employees rather than on an individual basis.  They preach there is no place for fear and intimidation in the work place yet throughout the company, top production VP's included, they will yell and threaten.  Not uncommon for so called "leaders" to pound tables and throw hard hats.  Kind of comical actually...  Always looking to place blame on a person rather than the process or managerial planning, or lack there of.  Real leadership does not exist.  Employees are a liability, not an asset.  Attitude is "next man up" with total disregard for the years of service and knowledge a person brings to the table.

review_title: Company's Wall Street Performance Valued Above People
pros: Salary and benefits are above industry standards. No formal, forced performance metrics or evaluations for salaries/bonus. Supervisors are to know specifically what you are doing and how you are performing.
cons:
Salary and benefits are above industry standards due to 24/7/365 access to employee "requirements". Vacations are to be taken; however if called you have less than 24 hours to get back to whatever deemed emergency needed you physically on site. 
High turnover in all positions that are below the VP level. Remaining staff is doing the jobs off all unfilled positions.  Cost cutting, personnel layoffs, postponing customer payments are driven by Wall Street commitments at quarter end reporting to hit numbers. 
Executive integrity does not exist. The emperor is never told he is wrong which also transfers to the Senior VP's and business units.

review_title: Good Company but Lacking Qualified Managers
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lake Forest, IL
pros:
- Great People
- Creative thinking
- Open Network to collaborate
- Forward thinking and explorative when new technologies are introduced
- Flexible working hours and environment
- Willing to create positions for people to expand and grow
cons:
- Pay is a little low for the creative positions given the experience
- Get it done and ask questions later mentality (whether right or wrong)
- Inexperienced DC Managers managing people who are more qualified they their direct reports.
- Lack of communication from the management teams. (An "I'm the manager and you're not" attitude.)

review_title: Worked there 18 yrs until they shut down plant
pros: Family like environment,fellow employees were great,pay scale just started to come around after 17 years.lol
cons: Lots of overtime and gotta beg to get more money and they keep expecting more work out of you but dnt wanna pay and then come in one day and say sorry to inform you that were closing your plant down but you can go to the union plant and lose your 4 weeks vacation a year and make $5.00 less an hour to start all over again. So that's the thanks you get for being dedicated to a corporation for 18 years. You decide do you want to work for a company that don't care for you and then stab you in the back

review_title: Colorado Container Corp was a good company to work for but things have gone downhill after PCA took over.
pros: Decent pay, Vacation, and personal time off.
cons: Poor 401k plan, pay freeze, some managment unfairly balance work expectations between favorites.

pros: They do pay good from the start all positions have a good pay rate once you are full time or finish ur probation period
cons:
They lie to you to get you in the door.
They force you to work without asking if your available or will consider you as abandoning your work station.
Make promises that they don't keep & when you call them out on it they say oh well there's nothing you can do about it.
Rude supervisors they talk down to everyone & talk loud to them.
Was told they work Saturday occasionally but have worked every Saturday since I started & other employees told me they've been working every Saturday for a year & a half before I started.

review_title: Great company. Each plant is its own entity. Not one plant is the same as the others.
pros: Excellent Pay and Benefits. Annual Gain Share
cons: Favoritism between employees and management that have come from other companies which in turn eliminates those that need to be held accountable. These issues are immediately noticed by current employees which in turn kills morale and eventually production/quality. Like adding gasoline to a fire. Great policy, great teaching and idea of culture but watch out for the buddy system. I really hate to speak of the company this way because it has not always been like this.

pros: Consistent work and working in the same place
cons: 6 days a week, mandatory overtime start, start at 4 am, no energy for life outside of work, destroys your body, morale was very low there, people there are just barely holding on, lots of temporary workers cycle through that you have to train (most of them are high),  we had several people that we had to train that couldn't read a tape measure nor an analog clock nor how to use a ratchet. Every month I was surprised that the company was still running.

pros: PCA is solid financially and they seem to care at the corporate level, I think anyway.
cons: The management office and plant treat sales people like they are not part of the team.  No help from mangement and the plants compete against each other.  No team work.

review_title: Hostile upper management at corporate level
pros: Good pay, hourly workers are like family. Many of us have been working here for over 30 years. We like it, its a good place to work.
cons: We used to be Boise Cascade. Since PCA bought out Boise we have been dealing with a corporate management with little dog syndrome. It creates a hostile work environment. Yelling and cursing at direct reports in front of hourly, etc. Our organization has lost a lot of knowledge due to this behavior. Many senior employees left for a better working experience.

review_title: If you're a woman and work here get out now if you're going to apply DON'T!!!
pros: Men get all the breaks otherwise there are no pros
cons: PCA took a bad company and made it worse when they bought Boise. Good ole boy network is alive and well, the hidden pay gap is huge and to add insult to injury, those on the lower end of the gap do all of the work, while the good ole boy cronies give each other 20 percent raises behind the scenes. I accidently found proof which made me sick after working 80+ weeks for nothing.

pros: Great People, treated well, sense of team, golden rule enviroment
cons: Sells to 5% of the market(I was told when hired I coud sell anyone anywhere), narrow window to sell, do not sell brown box truckload street business anymore, need complex sales to be successful. Commission rate lowest in industry because it is based on margin and volume, you can forget about the margin side of it. PCA pricing system is set up for the house. They keep individual sales awards a secret for some unexplained reason.

pros: Large, stable organization in acquisition mode.  Most people are enjoyable to work with.  Compensation package is fair.
cons: Policies and spoken philosophy are topical.  Dig deeper to find a very bureaucratic organization with all decisions driven by senior management that has lost sight of the forest for the trees.  Consistent hypocritical action has led to a culture of apathy.

review_title: Pca is a great place to work. Im looking to relocate and that the only reason.
pros: The pay is great and the opportunity to advance up the ranks is available.
cons: There are a lot of changes in management and some times you get bad managers and that can cause a your job to become harder because of the expectations of the new management.

pros: PCA bought the company I worked for and after about a year they gave pay increases to most of the people at our plant. That's the best I can say.
cons: PCA closed the plant I worked at for "business reasons" they claimed. Our plant was not originally a PCA plant and that is why they closed us and not one of their other plants in the area. People with 30+ years at this plant lost their jobs. They kept some people and moved them to other plants and these are people who should have been laid off.

pros: Good pay until you realize you have just sold your soul to disrespectful people who could care less about you. This is a pro mind you.
cons: You might as well sell your home because this place will become your new home.  If your looking to get away from family, friends, and anything else you might enjoy on your free time, apply.  Employees dub the Denver, CO plant "the plantation".  You'll sweat your but off 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and won't get as much as a "thanks" from a poorly constructed management team.

review_title: Best job around during the recession, a God-Send
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lake Forest, IL
pros: PCA has a small-company feel with a friendly environment. Co-workers feel like family and management seems to get we all have lives outside the office doors.
cons: Men seem to be promoted more often than women. There are women that have been here years in the same positions. It would be nice to see more women in upper management and more women promoted within the organization.

pros: Great Bennefits, pay is great. I believe it is over 23 an hour for new hires after 3 months, and more money do to excess overtime available and mandatory.
cons: Management will try to force overtime and at some points cross the legal law and threaten discipline if you answer call-in while off. Discipline isn't consistent with cases and union contract with discipline is not followed by company. Not considered a person. Just a number.

pros: People are wonderful, and if you are in with the right group you could go far. HR has changed and seems to be for the better, but they have much work to bring the company into the 21st century. Company seems to favor minorities, which makes for a nice, diverse working environment.
cons: PTO is not monitored through payroll, so some get 2 weeks and others get 6. Some departments are awesome and others play favoritism. Slackers seem to rule the roost, even when actions are pointed out to management.

job_title: Shift Supervisor in West Babylon, NY
pros: Good pay for the type of work. It is an industry that the country needs due to transportation regulations so it has some job security for the time being.  PCA takes care of the employees that do good work.
cons: Can be tedious working in a factory.  It is not the safest environment or the most comfortable. In order to stay ahead of the competition PCA makes promises that are hard to keep. Stress management is important.

review_title: PCA is now lost in the integration shuffle.
pros: Growing company (as a result of the recent acquisition of Boise, Inc.). Long-tenured employees who are incredibly loyal to the company.
cons: Growing company with long-tenured employees who are out of their element trying to manage the integration with Boise.  Communication has gotten very poor.

job_title: Valet Attendant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Flexible Scheduling and the possibility to make good money in tips if at a good property. If at a good property, you can network and meet a lot of great people and drive nice cars. Great co-workers, but again that is dependent on the property you're placed in. (Request fancy/high establishments for better tips)
cons: Like I said, if you have bad days or are at a bad property then tips can be bad, and you'll be stuck with minimum wage. Most valet work involves working in all sorts of weather, rain or shine.

pros: the co-workers are great. seriously like a family. i have only been there a short time but i feel very appreciated and comfortable. my department has 2 ladies and i am the third. they were and are very kind and patient with me. and also everyone else is very down to earth and kind. honestly like a family. we are team mates and i am so very proud to be a part of it.
cons: i am flat footed and also have other issues with my feet. the only con, for me is the steel toed shoes.

pros: Very strong company and always looking to improve operations. The company has a strong management team with paper background that understands the overall business. They have all worked their way up from operations.
cons: Some of their demands are a bit unrealistic but overall they just hold people accountable. Plant managers need to be able to manage their mills instead of having to get approval for everything.

review_title: Manual labor, great pay, great benefits, low recognition
job_title: Flexo Folder Gluer Operator in Liverpool, NY
pros: The pay is great, the bonuses and benefits are top notch. Consistent hours and paid vacation.
cons: Employee recognition is only there if you mess up, if you do something great and amazing like break a record, there's minimal attention from management when there should be noticeable praise.

review_title: Great experience working with people that were friendly and helpful at all times. God opportunity to develop customer
pros: Develop great customer service skills. Company gives flexible hours and management is very laid back and understanding. Always busy doing work, helping people
cons: Nothing to report. Everything was a positive experience and I can't really say anything was bad about the company. Recommend to other people. Only but the best things about this company

review_title: The company values its' people, so it is natural and easy to take care of the customer...
job_title: Sales Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
-Culture is the Golden Rule and the management practices what it preaches.
-chance to grow internally
-can make lots of money in sales
-very good training for employees
-the company recognizes and celebrates the employees
cons: -in sales, if one does not have the relationships to bring over, or does not grow  by the millions in the first 2 years, it is hard to make a living.

job_title: Rotary Diecut Operator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Pay and Benefits were all that was good.
cons: Management dont really care for you. Its all about the production of the company.  Safety is tweaked. I watched how one HARD WORKING employee that worked crazy OT and came in when they called and stayed late when they asked exhaust himself to the work. You know he loved his job. Well, This individual got injured and the company didnt want to take care of him and eventually letting him go.

review_title: Lives up to the mission statement "People, Customers, Trust"
pros: Great corporate culture, treat employees as people, not numbers, from plant level to upper management. Opportunites for growth and continuing education. Great salaries and benefits, as to be expected from a Fortune 500 company. Also reward dedicated employees with generous annual bonuses.
cons: Occasionly, some management can seem stuffy to someone not used to a Fortune 500 company environment.

review_title: PCA was a fast-paced workplace that required long hours and dedication.
pros: Friendly people, not a lot of office politics, hands-on environment. Everyone is fairly accessible and helpful. Managers are understanding and employees are always willing to help and teach.
cons: Manufacturing comes with a lot of drawbacks, such as long hours when a piece of equipment is down, or high stress due to contractor failure.

pros: This company is very smart with their investments and the way they treat their employees. Over the years they have accrued little debt, and as a result have grown very well in the past few years. Employees are given great opportunities for advancement while providing well balanced management.
cons: The locations of most of their mills are in small, rural towns that some potential employees may not find agreeable.

pros: Company has been around a long time and has many locations therefore there is ample opportunity to relocate to a more desirable part of the country or abroad. Pay is decent depending on area.
cons: Stress organization, yet very unorganized. Stress caring about employees yet hard to get positive or timely results. Communication is very lacking until time for employee anonymous surveys. Open door policy is a joke.

review_title: They emphisis the use of the "Golden Rule" until it's time to actually use it, then they go around it.
job_title: Flexographic Press Assistant in Liverpool, NY
pros: Great pay, great benefits, safety is #1 and they mean it, bonus 2 weeks before Christmas is a huge plus
cons: No room to move up in company, disiplinary actions are usually slaps on the wrist, don't regularly drug test employees who work on heavy machinery

pros: Management at all levels that focus on employees as people and developing them to their fullest potential. Excellent working conditions and benefits.
cons: Vertical management tiers that make it difficult to get decisions made in a timely manner. Many employees there a long time and can be resistant to new ideas or change.

pros: Great benefits; Friendly coworkers; generally competitive pay.
cons: Very antiquated ways of thinking on a corporate level; Cut corners on technology - systematically insist on competitive designs and prices but refuse to supply employees with the appropriate tools.

pros: Benefits were great.  401K was outstanding!  This company is growing.
cons: Facility managers rarely followed up on expectations.  Expectations were not thought thru, just pulled numbers out of a hat.  Rules constantly change.  Too many shades of gray.  Very difficult to get results when 3 shifts are not working towards the same goals.  Hourly employees become frustrated and feel confused, low morale.

job_title: Customer Service Associate in Lake Forest, IL
pros: The starting pay offered to me was at the mid level scale for someone with a Masters Degree.  Ok
cons: The corporate headquarters management team was very negative toward all employees of color. No one was allowed to advance or even consider going to another team. Also they would rather get you off the payroll than consider a annual review and raise.

pros: Decent pay, gain expierice quickly, challenging, decent safety culture
cons: Not a place to work if you're a woman or a young engineer. Will force you out if you don't follow the career progression they pick out for you. The expectation is to live at work, salaried is required to carry cell phones 24/7 and come in at the drop of a hat. Management lacks technical knowledge to run process.

pros: Great pay and benefits.  Lots of job security if you are willing to come to work every day.  Benefits are awesome.
cons: No room for advancement.  They have completely moved away from promoting from within.  If you are happy getting to a certain position and staying there forever then this might be the job for you.

pros: No pros at all for this company
cons: No family life if you have a family you can kiss that good bye. Management dont care about nothing but getting a bonus at the end of the day. I've worked every holiday and they think you should be happy with that. They will lie to get to you in the door to work for them. Dont join they union cause it has no say so when it comes to management or the company.

pros: Great company to work for. Managerial positions given lots of room to utilize their strengths to incorporate ideas to better serve the overall goals of the shipping operations. Constantly presented with opportunities to show ones competency.
cons: Lots of work gets funneled to one or two people, success or failure is the result of the ability of those people to work and manage efficiently.

review_title: PCA was very generous with it's employees through financial compensation and very good benefits.
pros: Corporate PCA had benevolent oversight of the local facilitities. But those local facilities had the flexibility to optimize their unique strengths and talents. Having fifty plus offices, there was always a plant best suited for any customer.
cons: The employee-chemistry was crucial, for the effectiveness of the independence of all the separate plants.

review_title: Good place if you love learning on the job with a fast and demanding environment.
pros:
•Good work environment 
• Improved communication skills
• Fast paced environment
cons: If something breaks or goes down in your department. You are expected to stay until start up occurs and test the product.

review_title: I worked for Boise until pca.....
pros: Good pay great benefits decent morale. If you need a tool you will have it.
cons: Knee jerk reactions to every little thing. One rule may override 5 others so go with what you heard last. Constant rumors of change. Did not treat our senior employees fairly after the acquisition. I saw 200 years of experience fired in 1 day.

pros: Good entry level job, overtime, paid breaks, some benefits very good to. Some of supervisors nice guys.
cons:
This is union company, so you never can not grow where, "old" guys alway got best position even if you are working twice better. 
 Old plant, old equipment (always have problems with that). 
 Very hot inside (especially at Summer time). Long shifts (have to stay on leg 9-10 hours).

job_title: Machine Center Operator in Plymouth, MI
pros: If you value your life do not work for this company. They value production and customer demand over the safety and we'll being of their employees
cons: Safety protocol is decades behind every other major industry on the planet. Management displays gross level of incompetence on a daily basis, and promotes a production over safety driven culture. Management turns a blind eye to major  OSHA safety violations in trade for product out the door numbers. Literally the worst morale I've ever experienced in my working career

pros: 401K, The coworkers are hard working good people to work with. All the people in inside the plant and outside sales really worked hard to satisfy and take care of the customer.
cons: Need to actually listen to your employees and take actions to implement ideas or suggestions. Many times felt as if no one was listening.

pros: Fair salary. Good working conditions.  Good 401k.
cons: Salary groups are too thin. Hours are exhausting. If you are not a member of "the good ole boy group", you will never be given opportunities to advance. No matter how hard you work.

pros: Great Colleagues and Accounts to Work With, Competitive Salary, Good Office Space, Latitude to Perform
cons: Less than Desirable Leadership (Lack of Clearly Defined Strategy and Goals, Lack of Coherent Collaboration and Teamwork) Presence of "Boys Club" and Related Behaviors (Including Intimidation from Senior Management)

pros: Great benefits,  decent pay, advancement opportunities within plant, most plants are union shops, overall great company to be employed through.
cons: Sometimes have to work shifts that you don't want to, work a lot of Saturdays, management never happy with production numbers

pros: Lots of good people to work with.
cons: Computer programs used were new 20 years ago. Napoleon complex runs rampant. Good 'ol boys club, unless you are a part of it, you career stops there.

review_title: Overall good, but job is demanding and has too much politics
pros: Good pay, lots of resources, wide variety of equipment, open to paying for training.
cons: Early mornings, long hours, lots of politics, and miss directed management.

job_title: Accounting Associate in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The benefits were great at PCA, and I worked with alot of great people that taught me great work ethic.
cons: There was not a lot of room to grow. I felt that I was stuck in my position with no room to grow.

pros: Wonderful manager, great co-workers, very little drama, no micro-managing, excellent benefits. Some departments/managers have more drama than others, and I am lucky to work in a department that doesn't have to deal with much of the corporate b.s.
cons: Computer programs need to be updated, but work ok for what they are. Days are nose-to-the-grindstone busy, but over time is rare.

review_title: A good company with room for improvements
pros:
Hourly employees have a wealth of knowledge.
Fair pay, decent work/life balance.
Decent mentorship.
cons:
Locations are generally boring and far-removed.
Company is still in the process of moving documentation to fully electronic format - many P&IDs have gone without updates for years.

pros: Hourly people are amazing. Excellent pay and benefits.
cons: Management is absolutely horrible. They treat the employees horrible, and make what should be a decent job a horrible job. They have a huge turnover for the amount of money we make.

review_title: Wonderful culture and family oriented organization.
job_title: Sales Manager in Lake Forest, IL
pros: Very conservative and not too top heavy.  Directives from corporate to facilities is always straight forward and direct.   Very lean and senior managers always seems approachable.
cons: I do not see a lot of new young talent entering the industry.  Wish the company was more aggressive in recruiting young talent.

pros: I have a really great boss. The best thing is that he knows and understands the business and what we all go through. He encourages constant training and believes in being the best.
cons: The point system is a killer when life can bring unavoidable events

job_title: Team Member in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Employee incentives are very nice. Union company for those who believe in Quality Partnerships. Consistent workflow for employees and employer, which bonds customer relationships.
cons: Housekeeping is always being met. However, working in the manufacturing business of packaging products, it can become overwhelming with dust.

pros: Good benefits,people. Good desks.short-term disability.
cons: Since Medco migration the performance goals have been set too high for problems. Pay cut is not what I signed up for. Medco workers were union and ESI busted the union. Those left should get large pay increases, not decreases!!!

pros: Was able to work summers as a college student. Worked full time and was paid pretty well.
cons: Paid less than regular employees for doing the same work, little recognition. Managers not willing to provide a reference for you after you leave. Supervisors were incompetent at times and often make you make decisions to cover their butts.

pros: People, culture, pay, benefits, vacation
cons: Old school status quo company resistant to change. High priced and uncompetitive pricing due to mismanagement of business. Overcharges customers to pay for management perks such as office parties, golf memberships, sporting event tickets, etc.

pros: Many caring and helpful coworkers. Decent pay for most positions.
cons: Upper management that isn't trustworthy. In the company you are only a number. The company is portrayed much differently to the stockholders and in public marketing pieces than what is actual in day to day events.

pros: Awesome Management, administration wasn't afraid to work with the workers in the shop, great pay structure, workers were friendly towards the summer help and were always willing to explain what you didn't understand so you could do the job correctly.
cons: The smell took a bit to get used to (next to a pulp mill)

pros: Good pay and benefits. The "Golden Rule" culture is not just spoken about but they legitimately try to put it into practice. The company offers many great training opportunities and strives to build into their people.
cons: Work/Life balance is difficult to achieve. Worked many, many 60-70 hour weeks with little choice in the matter.

review_title: PCA Family is the only FAMILY I See
pros: Benefits: great insurance coverage for employees and families. OT available, expected
cons: Long days/weeks without being able to make plans, spend time with family-most 1 day/week off

pros: Great pay and benefits. People on your team are great to work with.
cons:
Upper management is terrible. "What have you done for me lately" mentality.
No work life balance. 
Always traveling and constantly stressed out.

pros: Long on experience and hands-on know-how. Outstanding reputation which opens many doors for you. Access to some of the finest resources available in the industry.
cons: Political, bureaucratic, inflexible. To take my experiences an apply them to the whole company would be wrong. It varies by location and it matter who is running the place.

review_title: I have had a great time working here. Great job security
job_title: Flexo Operator in West Valley City, UT
pros: Job security, pay is great for what you do. Never have to worry about if you will get paid.
cons: It is hard to take time off for a vacation. This company aslo works by a point system for attendence

job_title: Machine Operator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Competitive pay nice benefits. Good location
cons: Overworked. Asked to do more than any other operator currently working there. No accountability for the rest of the crew you are working with so everything falls upon the operator. Consistently working weekends.

review_title: PCA is one of those jobs that keeps you active all day but makes your day at work go by faster. :)
pros: Active, team work, good management, good pay, benefits and overtime if you need it.
cons: No opportunity to advance or move up in the company.

job_title: Inventory Clerk and Administrative Assistant in Columbus, GA
pros: They were a good company to work for but were lying to me the entire time.Stringing me along on false pretenses
cons: Promised to hire me for two years the let me go w/out any warning and of no fault of my own. (Their words)

pros: Good compensation, work environment, decent respect of work/life balance
cons: Sometimes poor documentation, generally small-town locations (not necessarily a con), sometimes lots of "covering your own you-know-what", average ability to move up

pros: Good pay nice people to work with on the floor
cons: They have a bs way of treating good people it's alot about who u know or kind to

pros: The company only holds on to the people they see big potential in; once they do, you take very good care of you.
cons: Stuck in their ways, work environment gets rather old.

job_title: Glue Machine Operator in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Pay is good.  A lot of over time. Ability to move up in the company.  Great benefits.
cons: Having to work a shift you don't like.  They don't really give you days off so it's easy to point out and get fired.  Starting pay.

review_title: Not as angry as I was 1 week ago.
pros: You will make 6 figures
cons: You will sacrifice your family and life to do so.

pros: Some great coworkers, good training, professional.
cons: Can't compete with other companies in same business. Antiquated management style, egotistical environment, unwilling to adjust to market conditions, focused on stockholder profits with no regard to employees. Advancement based on who you know, not merit.

pros: The company is big on a national scene,but feels much more personal at the local level. The management team is good.
cons: There isn't a direct line for advancement.  To move upward, someone has to leave or retirement to make space for you.

pros: Very good experience in working with customers. Learn a lot about physical testing and get a hands on experience. Get to experience everything that your mentor does.
cons: There's really no chance at getting hired on since they just keep getting new co-op students every year.

pros: Great benefits and workplace atmosphere. Lots of variety of projects for engineers. Room for career advancement all the way to a corporate traveling position if desired.
cons: Typically 45+ hours per week needed and small amount of vacation. Union shop makes job less hands on.

pros: Good pay, insurance is slightly better than average, nice fellow employees,
cons: Company did not seem to care about employees or personal life. When safety issues were brought to company attention, they did not want to hear about them. Then you were on their list.

review_title: Not Bad If You Like Small Work Environments
pros: Small work environment with only 4 people allows for a nice work environment.
cons: BoD makes getting some things completed difficult since they are all chiropractors by profession and might not always understand the business side of the association.

pros: PCA is a great place to work.  The management team is top-notch. The work environment is pleasant.  The offices are well equipped.  The IT department is the best.
cons: I can not think of any cons

review_title: Great company. Follows the Golden Rule.
pros: Great people company. Lots of opportunities for promotion into management for smart hardworking and dedicated employees. On the job training provided.
cons: Industrial work. Manual labor.

pros: The HQ is centrally located in Lake Forest, IL.
cons: Poor management, product is substandard, Employee relationship extremely poor, Knowledge base is poor. Company is based upon hiring friends in key positions, not upon knowledge or ability. Company may have higher pay, because they have no pension plans. Company uses loud vulgar language to entice employees to perform. Boys club, men only.

pros: One of the best place . Supervisor are very friendly, polite and professional. Safety is always first.. It was a good experience.unfurtunily was a temporary job.
cons: Some times so many great things make hard work be easy.

pros: Good pay, good benefits, operators are very knowledgeable and they are good people
cons: Management treats you horrible, they expect you to read their minds. They do not conduct themselves properly, they talk bad about you behind your back. They do not believe in vacations. They do not promote safety. Would not recommend working there. The don’t pay enough to justify the way they treat you.

review_title: Need a little less talk and a lot more action
pros: People that work here on the hourly side of the business
cons: Junk machines, management does not listen to employees very political

pros: Great Pay, Excellent People, Extreme feeling of self-worth.
cons: Management plays favorites. Very hot and physical labor. Crews can be hard on each other

pros: good benefits and the hourly workers are great people. plenty of overtime available if you want it.
cons: Omaha location very unorganized and slow to change.  Some of the management team is very nasty.

pros: Good iincentive pay plus hourly
cons: work weekends can't be avoided if you want to make a decent living

pros: None. Pay was great. But you had to sell your soul.
cons: Management sucks. Lake Forest has no people of color, or very few. No place to grow for the ones that are there.

job_title: Business Development Associate in Chicago, IL
pros:
The company is huge but operates individually per location. 
The company does support your career growth. The benefits are fantastic, and the people are caring.
cons: The company comes first - all the time.

job_title: Machine Operator in Gas City, IN
pros: Good pay, the corporation seems to be good it's but they allow local to mistreat employees as much as they want as long as they don't fire them.
cons: Very poor focus and everything is set of for management to work the lest as possible and hourly make up the slack. Very poor safety

pros: PCA is a great company.
